title: The Sure Thing
excerpt: What successful entrepreneurs have in common.

title: ‘I feel like I’m selling my soul’: inside the crisis at Juventus
excerpt: The long read: A series of financial scandals have rocked Italy’s most glamorous club. But is the trouble at Juventus symptomatic of a deeper rot in world football?

title: How the Biggest Fraud in German History Unravelled
excerpt: The tech company Wirecard was embraced by the German élite. But a reporter discovered that behind the façade of innovation were lies and links to Russian intelligence.

title: The Getty Family’s Trust Issues
excerpt: Heirs to an iconic fortune sought out a wealth manager who would assuage their progressive consciences. Now their dispute is exposing dynastic secrets.

title: The $2 Billion Mall Rats
excerpt: The inside story of a black sheep hedge fund, a massive bet that shopping malls would crash, and how they proved Wall Street wrong.

title: Mark Carney: ‘I didn’t want the Bank of England job. But I was asked to fix something’
excerpt: He earned a fortune at Goldman Sachs, but now the banker wants the financial sector to reassess its values and tackle the climate emergency

title: How the Most Hyped U.S. Oil Merger in a Decade Went Bust
excerpt: As CEO of Occidental Petroleum, Vicki Hollub made the biggest deal the oil business had seen in years. Will it also go down as the biggest failure?

title: How Renaissance’s Medallion Fund Became Finance’s Blackest Box
excerpt: The Medallion Fund, an employees-only offering for the quants at Renaissance Technologies, is the blackest box in all of finance.

title: Bank of the Underworld - The Atlantic
excerpt: Liberty Reserve was like PayPal for the unbanked. Was it also a global money-laundering operation?

title: I Worked at Capital One for Five Years. This Is How We Justified Piling Debt on Poor Customers.
excerpt: The subprime lending giant is a textbook case in creating a corporate culture of denial.

title: The real Goldfinger: the London banker who broke the world
excerpt: The true story of how the City of London invented offshore banking – and set the rich free

title: How America’s Oldest Gun Maker Went Bankrupt: A Financial Engineering Mystery (Published 2019)
excerpt: When a secretive private equity firm bought Remington, sales were strong and the future bright. A decade later, the company couldn’t escape its debts.

title: The Triple Jeopardy of a Chinese Math Prodigy
excerpt: A secretive hedge fund used the British court system to punish an IP thief‚ even though he was already in jail.

title: Inside the 20-year decline of Toys R Us
excerpt: Cost cuts, stressed employees, intercompany rivalries, dirty floors, dusty rafters, glitchy IT, fudged metrics: The people who ran the failed toy retailer's stores know what went wrong.

title: Revealed: The Secrets Of One Of The World's Dirtiest Banks And Its Powerful
excerpt: Blatant forgery. Snarling guard dogs. Shredded evidence. An incendiary cache of leaked documents reveals the farcical scramble inside one of the world’s dirtiest banks to conceal incriminating information from US government investigators – while some of the most prestigious accountants and lawyers on the planet used all their power to keep the bank in business.
